trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> objects.

This class represents the collection of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> objects stored in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenu>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem>.
For the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenu> classes, this collection represents the entire menu structure for the control.
For the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> class, this collection represents the list of submenu items associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Add%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Remove%2A> methods enable you to add and remove individual menu items from the collection.
You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Clear%2A> method to remove all the menu items from the collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection"></xref> class.

This class requires that you associate the collection with a class that derives from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu>, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenu>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> class.
Since you must specify a menu that is associated with this collection, you cannot create multiple menu item collections and associate them with a menu as needed.
In order to switch the menu items associated with a menu, you must clear the collection of items and add the menu items to display to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Menu"></xref> that owns this collection.
Adds a new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref>, to the end of the current menu, with a specified caption.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> can only be contained in one menu at a time, and cannot be added more than once to the same menu.
To reuse a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> in more than one menu, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem.CloneMenu%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> class.
To remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> that you have previously added, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Remove%2A> method.
The caption of the menu item.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> that represents the menu item being added to the collection.
Adds a previously created <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> to the end of the current menu.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> can only be contained in one menu at a time, and cannot be added more than once to the same menu.
To reuse a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> in more than one menu, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem.CloneMenu%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> class.
To remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> that you have previously added, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Remove%2A> method.

This version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Add%2A> method allows you to add previously created <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> objects to the end of the menu item collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> to add.
The zero-based index where the item is stored in the collection.
Adds a previously created <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> at the specified index within the menu item collection.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> can only be contained in one menu at a time, and cannot be added more than once to the same menu.
To reuse a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> in more than one menu, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem.CloneMenu%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> class.
To remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> that you have previously added, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Remove%2A> method.

This version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Add%2A> method allows you to add previously created <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> objects to a specific index location within the collection.
Any <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> currently located at that index, and all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> objects after that index, are moved to the next lowest index in the collection.
The position to add the new item.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> to add.
The zero-based index where the item is stored in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> being added is already in use.
The index supplied in the index parameter is larger than the size of the collection.

Adds a new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> to the end of the current menu with a specified caption and a specified event handler for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem.Click"></xref> event.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> can only be contained in one menu at a time, and cannot be added more than once to the same menu.
To reuse a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> in more than one menu, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem.CloneMenu%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> class.
To remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> that you have previously added, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Remove%2A> method.

This version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Add%2A> method allows you to specify a caption for the menu item and a delegate to handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem.Click> event.

You can use this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Add%2A> method if your application already has an event handler to handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem.Click> event.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem.Click> event is not raised for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> that contains submenu items.
The caption of the menu item.

An <xref href="System.EventHandler"></xref> that represents the event handler that is called when the item is clicked by the user, or when a user presses an accelerator or shortcut key for the menu item.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> that represents the menu item being added to the collection.
Adds a new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> to the end of this menu with the specified caption, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem.Click"></xref> event handler, and items.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> can only be contained in one menu at a time, and cannot be added more than once to the same menu.
To reuse a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> in more than one menu, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem.CloneMenu%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> class.
To remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> that you have previously added, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Remove%2A> method.

This version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Add%2A> method allows you to specify a caption for the menu item and a delegate that will handle its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem.Click> event.

You can use this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Add%2A> method if your application already has an event handler to handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem.Click> event.
This version of the method also allows you to specify an array of previously created <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> objects that you want to add to the collection.
You can use this feature to reuse existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> objects that have been cloned using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem.CloneMenu%2A> method.
If the `items` parameter is not empty or `null`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> being added to the collection will contain submenu items.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem.Click> event is not raised for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> that contains submenu items.
The caption of the menu item.
An array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> objects that this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> will contain.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> that represents the menu item being added to the collection.
Adds an array of previously created <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> objects to the collection.

You can use method to quickly add a group of previously created <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> objects to the collection instead of manually adding each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> to the collection using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Add%2A> method.
If the collection already contains <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> objects, calling this method will add the new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> objects to the end of the collection.
An array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> objects representing the menu items to add to the collection.
Removes all <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> objects from the menu item collection.
You can use this method to clear the entire collection of menu items from a menu.
To remove an individual menu item from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Remove%2A> method.
To add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Add%2A> method.
Determines if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> is a member of the collection.
This method enables you to determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> is member of the collection before attempting to perform operations on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem>.
You can use this method to confirm that a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> has been added to or is still a member of the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> to locate in the collection.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> is a member of the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the collection contains an item with the specified key.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.ContainsKey%2A> returns `false.`
The name of the item to look for.
`true` if the collection contains an item with the specified key, otherwise, `false`.
Copies the entire collection into an existing array at a specified location within the array.
You can use this method to combine <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> objects from multiple collections into a single array.
This feature enables you to easily combine two or more sets of menu items for use in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenu> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu>.
The destination array.
The index in the destination array at which storing begins.
Gets a value indicating the total number of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> objects in the collection.
The `Count` property holds the number of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> objects assigned to the collection.
You can use the `Count` property value as the upper bounds of a loop to iterate through a collection.
Keep in mind, the index value of a collection is a zero-based index, so you must subtract one from the looping variable.
If you do not account for this, you will exceed the upper bounds of the collection and throw an exception.
The number of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> objects in the collection.
Finds the items with the specified key, optionally searching the submenu items
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, or there are no matches, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Find%2A> returns an empty array.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection>.
The name of the menu item to search for.
`true` to search child menu items; otherwise, `false`.
An array of objects whose property matches the specified key.
key is `null` or an empty string.
Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the menu item collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that represents the menu item collection.
Retrieves the index of a specific item in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of the item found in the collection; otherwise, -1.
Finds the index of the first occurrence of a menu item with the specified key.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, or there are no matches, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> returns -1.
The name of the menu item to search for.
The zero-based index of the first menu item with the specified key.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> at the specified indexed location in the collection.

To assign <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> objects to a specific location, or to retrieve them from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection>, you can reference the collection object with a specific index value.
The index value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection> is a zero-based index.
The indexed location of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> at the specified location.
The value parameter is `null`.
or
The index parameter is less than zero.
or
The index parameter is greater than the number of menu items in the collection, and the collection of menu items is not `null`.
Gets an item with the specified key from the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection.Item%2A> returns `null.`
The name of the item to retrieve from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> with the specified key.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> from the menu item collection.
When a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> is removed from the menu item collection, all subsequent menu items are moved up one position in the collection.
You can use this version of the `Remove` to remove a specific <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> from the collection using a reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> to be removed.

If you do not have a reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> that you want to remove, you can use the other version of this method that accepts, as a parameter, an index corresponding to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> to be removed.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> to remove.
Removes a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> from the menu item collection at a specified index.
When a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> is removed from the menu item collection, all subsequent menu items are moved up one position in the collection.
The index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> to remove.
Removes the menu item with the specified key from the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
The name of the menu item to remove.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`false` in all cases.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Add(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> to add to the collection.
The position into which the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> was inserted.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Contains(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The object to locate in the collection.
`true` if the specified object is a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IndexOf(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index if value is a in the collection; otherwise -1.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index at which the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> should be inserted.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> to insert into the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`false` in all cases.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Item(System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index of the element to get.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> at the specified index.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Remove(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Menu.MenuItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem"></xref> to remove.
